docs.summary: The wix-site module contains functionality for obtaining information about your site and its pages.
description: To use the site module, import `wixSite` from the `wix-site` module:
``` javascript
import wixSite from 'wix-site';
The APIs in `wix-site` can only be used in front-end code.

srcDocs.summary: The wix-site module contains functionality for obtaining information about your site and its pages.
description: To use the site module, import `wixSite` from the `wix-site` module:
``` javascript
import wixSite from 'wix-site';
The APIs in `wix-site` can only be used in front-end code.

ret.doc: An object that contains information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.
ret.srcDoc: An object that contains information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.

docs.summary: Returns information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.

examples.title: Get information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes

srcDocs.summary: Returns information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.

examples.title: Get information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes

params.name: routerPrefix
params.doc: The prefix of the router to get the sitemap for.
params.srcDoc: The prefix of the router to get the sitemap for.

ret.doc: undefined. on fulfilled - A list of sitemap entries.. on rejected - The error that caused the rejection.
ret.srcDoc: undefined. on fulfilled - A list of sitemap entries.. on rejected - The error that caused the rejection.

docs.summary: Returns the sitemap for a router or dynamic page prefix.
description: The `routerSitemap()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of
[`WixSitemapEntry`](wix-router.WixRouterSitemapEntry.html) objects. Each
[`WixSitemapEntry`](wix-router.WixRouterSitemapEntry.html) includes
information about a page, such as its URL, title, and name.
A sitemap is used by search engines to find the links to the site's pages.

examples.title: Get the sitemap for a prefix

srcDocs.summary: Returns the sitemap for a router or dynamic page prefix.
description: The `routerSitemap()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of
[`WixSitemapEntry`](wix-router.WixRouterSitemapEntry.html) objects. Each
[`WixSitemapEntry`](wix-router.WixRouterSitemapEntry.html) includes
information about a page, such as its URL, title, and name.
A sitemap is used by search engines to find the links to the site's pages.

examples.title: Get the sitemap for a prefix

docs.summary: An object that contains information about the site's prefixes.
description: A site's routers, dynamic pages, and app pages all have prefixes.

examples.title: Get information about the site's prefixes

srcDocs.summary: An object that contains information about the site's prefixes.
description: A site's routers, dynamic pages, and app pages all have prefixes.

examples.title: Get information about the site's prefixes

members.name: type
members.docs: The type of the prefix: `"dynamicPages"`, `"router"`, or `"app"`.
members.srcDocs: The type of the prefix: `"dynamicPages"`, `"router"`, or `"app"`.

members.name: applicationId
members.docs: If the prefix is an app's prefix, the `applicationId` property is the app's ID.
members.srcDocs: If the prefix is an app's prefix, the `applicationId` property is the app's ID.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.
description: The `SiteStructure` object is a flattened representation of the site. Use
the [`getSiteStructure()`](#getSiteStructure) function to get the site's
`SiteStructure` object. The structure does not include the headers and links
from the site's **Pages** menu.

examples.title: Get information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes

srcDocs.summary: An object that contains information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes.
description: The `SiteStructure` object is a flattened representation of the site. Use
the [`getSiteStructure()`](#getSiteStructure) function to get the site's
`SiteStructure` object. The structure does not include the headers and links
from the site's **Pages** menu.

examples.title: Get information about the site's pages, prefixes, and lightboxes

members.name: prefixes
members.docs: The prefixes of the site's routers and dynamic pages.
members.srcDocs: The prefixes of the site's routers and dynamic pages.

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a lightbox on the site.

examples.title: Get information about the site's lightboxes

srcDocs.summary: An object that contains information about a lightbox on the site.

examples.title: Get information about the site's lightboxes

docs.summary: An object that contains information about a page on the site.
description: The `StructurePage` object represents a page in the site. The page can be a
regular page, dynamic page, router page, or page from an app.

examples.title: Get information about the site's pages

srcDocs.summary: An object that contains information about a page on the site.
description: The `StructurePage` object represents a page in the site. The page can be a
regular page, dynamic page, router page, or page from an app.

examples.title: Get information about the site's pages

members.name: type
members.docs: The type of the page: `"static"` or `"template"`.
members.srcDocs: The type of the page: `"static"` or `"template"`.

members.name: url
members.docs: The URL of the page. If the page is a `static` page the `url` property is the page's SEO URL.
members.srcDocs: The URL of the page. If the page is a `static` page the `url` property is the page's SEO URL.

members.name: applicationId
members.docs: If the page is an app page, the `applicationId` property is the app's ID.
members.srcDocs: If the page is an app page, the `applicationId` property is the app's ID.

members.name: prefix
members.docs: If the page is a router or dynamic page, the `prefix` property is the page's prefix.
members.srcDocs: If the page is a router or dynamic page, the `prefix` property is the page's prefix.
